comment: This is a classic case of a professor thinking that THEIR class is the only class you are taking, because she has no problem absolutely bombarding you with assignments. Multiple video speaking assignments, writing assignments, a music assignment, and 8-10 assignments from the textbook WEEKLY. Just take this class with a different professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Ive never had a more caring professor! You can reach out to her anytime and shell respond fast. All assignments through connect. 2 recordings, 2 writing assignments, 3 tests on connect, & one final video project. Not a hard class AT ALL. If you can, TAKE HER CLASS!! Its harder to fail and she truly wants the best for her students.

I have taken around 15 online classes, and this takes the cake as the most poorly structured. *BUT*, Professor Ribeiro was very nice & extremely willing to work with us around due dates & take suggestions about class structure. All in all, once we got it all sorted out, it was quite the easy A, and I found myself wishing I could take 1002 with her!

She was really nice. I took her online and it wasn't bad at all. The only thing though is she never responded to my emails and if she did she'd only respond to the ones she wanted to. My class was confused a lot because she didn't make things clear but if you go on D2L and go through the checklist every week you should be okay.

Professor Ribeiro's SPAN 1001 course is incredibly easy in terms of the content presented and the level at which you are expected to understand it but, her organization and lack of accurate instructions make this class very difficult in that she will change the dates that certain assignments are due and not post the updated due dates.

If you are careful to read the weekly assignment checklist AND separate assignment folders AND double check connect assignments, the class is a breeze. The only issue I had was that she did not have all of our assignments and due dates located in the same spot. The class itself is super easy though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Ribeiro was a great teacher. She was really sweet, and it was always easy to reach her by email. She could improve in the area of organization I believe. It took me until October to find an efficient way to figure out what assignments were due when. However, if you are careful to read and reread the assignment list every week, you'll be fine.
She was awesome. Lots of different types of work to help learn the information. I would love to take her again. Very encouraging and fun.

I took Spanish I online with Lucia Ribeiro. The material wasn't hard, but it was made hard by the fact that Professor Ribeiro is incredibly unorganized and doesn't know how to make use of D2L's many features that indicate due dates and instead opts to create a weekly checklist that often contradicts her assignment schedule. Absolutely annoying.

Easily my favorite professor in the department. Having taken her more than once, I've seen that she wants all of her students to succeed. Her instructions are always straight forward and she is extremely lenient with grading. Homework is weekly but it is not excessive. As long as you show up and try to make a good grade, you will ace this course.

Sra. Ribeiro was not the worst professor I had, but having taken this class online, she did not try at all to be personable. Her instructions were unclear and she posted updates every couple of weeks at most! Her essay guidelines were posted with last years information causing many of us to turn it in late or not have the required information.

Class was pretty easy, only downside is that everything is in Connect. You are basically teaching yourself everything with Connect, which was a challenge at times. She was understanding of due dates and tried her best to keep everyone on task.

She's a great teacher. She's hilarious, and slightly scatterbrained. She's very time flexible, and you pretty much decide when you want to turn things in. There's a lot of easy online homework, and class is fun. She'll talk to you like she's a student too. There's a few easy papers, and she tells you what's on the test. Do the work, and it's easy.

Sra. Ribeiro is a great professor. If anyone doesn't like her class, it's because they either didn't come, didn't participate, or didn't do any of the work. She is very lenient with the work. She will reopen assignments if you ask her. She is more focused on you understanding, than getting through the course content fast. She is very sweet, very funny, and enthusiastic. She obviously loves what she's doing and cares about her students. She is a great Spanish 1 teacher, and I wish I could take her for Spanish 2.
Just so hard!  Do Not take the online class.  it is impossible.  You have to speak into software and don't have enough time to finish your work.  I got a C.

Your attendance grade goes does for every class that you miss.  If you say a word incorrectly in class, you lose points.  If you ask questions, she gets angry.  DONOT take her.  It was a complete headached of a class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: You have quite a few group projects that she grades harshely and grades you on participation.  Her tests are nothing like the review.  Most people get c's.  I wouldn't advise taking this teacher.  GPA dropper
Impossible teacher.  Do NOT Take.   Incredibly hard tests.

Took her online course. There is a lot of homework and it takes time especially if you do not have a good understanding of Spanish. There are also weekly discussions and three written assignments. Just stay on top of your work and you'll be fine.

She is so easy. She does her best to accommodate each and every student in the class. She wants everyone in the class to succeed and get an A! I got a 100.2% in the class. She is always focused on benefiting the students. And always asks what we want to do for our grades. Could not ask for a better professor and Easy A! Love her to death!
took as a hybrid. need to have two years in high school and it's simple. just show up and do the homework. tests are easy and she'll answer any question you have.

I took the hybrid class and it was very easy and I enjoyed the class. I would not take the class if you don't have a decent background in spanish because the class is a hybrid. She sets the class up to where you do all the work online and class is for asking clarification questions.

Her online class is so hard with an incredible amount of homework.  She alsoo grades harshely and late.  Take the in class offering instead because online you get no help whatsoever when you don't understand.  I have a c and am unhappy.

Professor Ribeiro is AWESOME I'm  currently taking 1002 and took 1001 last semester She's very nice and will help you She wants everybody to pass 3tests&final she will go over what will be on the test 1 project hw from websam vocab summary cultura fotonovela 120 words in spanish over a movie  Her lecture is fun! TAKE HER!

Funny but hella confusing. Assignments are unclear and she tends to ramble. However. She's nice and very willing to help. Several tests, so read the entire chapter (Culture sections are important so don't skip them). Also do the online work
